title: Holetown
description: The Holetown Branch Library is in St. James. Originally named Jamestown, after its benefactor, King James I of England it is the parish of the first settlement in Barbados. This branch is located in the Holetown Government Complex on the western side of the “Holetown Monument” built to commemorate the first English landing in Barbados in 1625. Our services include access to EBSCO online database which contains e-books journals, newspapers and magazines, a Lending section for adults, children, young adults and visitors, as well as photocopying and computer services, free Internet access and a storytelling hour for children on Saturdays from 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. Our regular hours are Monday to Friday 10:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. and Saturday 9 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.
